title: Car rental in the U.S. - total cars in service 2002 to 2012
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Cars in service in thousands, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 4 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately negative which exists from 2003 to 2007.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is slightly positive which exists from 2007 to 2010.
Likewise, the next significant trend is extremely negative which exists from 2010 to 2012.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2002 to 2003.
gold: This statistic represents the US rental car industry 's total number of cars in service between 2002 and 2012 . In 2012 , there were about 1.86 million rental cars in service , while the industry 's revenue grew to around 23.6 billion US dollars .
